channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Major delays - dangerous 3 way lights, 1st September
item.description:
40 minute delays Cars jumping three way lights Inefficient timing allows a few cars across No diversion signage for alternative routes Urgent response needed Dangerous manoeuvres Cars driving on the opposite side of the road to get to turnings hundreds of yards down the road to avoid waiting
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Field House Shurdington Road, Shurdington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary lights and no road works, 1st September
item.description:
Unaccustomed as I am to complaining, I feel that I have to put "pen to paper" in this instance. Heading West on the A46 last night, I went through a set of temporary, 3-way lights at the junction with Badgeworth Lane. There were no road works at that time. Went through the lights this morning as they were on green, still no road works... This evening, returning home from work, we experienced, as did thousands of other motorists, a 30 minute delay to get through these temporary lights, only to find that the road works still haven't started !! 24 hours of delayed traffic, costing thousands of pounds of wasted fuel by thousands of motorists. When these civil engineering companies apply to close off sections of road, are they allowed to close the road off one day and then come back to start work when they feel like it ?? They should be made to remove the lights and not set them up until they are ready to start work.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Longlands Shurdington Road, Shurdington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car parked fully in pavement, 30th August
item.description:
A non English registration car has been park fully on the pavement. It has been there since around 1pm today (30/08). There is no way for anyone to pass this car without going fully into the road and there is only a pavement on this side of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 33 Tudor Close, Churchdown
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous deep potholes, 30th August
item.description:
A section of this road approx 1.5 miles long is pitted with many deep potholes. It should be remembered that this is a commonly used cycling route which in many places is difficult to safely navigate. A serious accident waiting to happen!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Withington
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mud/sand in road, 30th August
item.description:

item.title: Large section of streetlights out on Hatherley Road, 28th August
item.description:
I couldn't tell exactly where but it started around Bournside Road and I believe went on past Hatherley Court Road (heading into town). It was both sides. Some houses had lights on so I don't believe it was a general power cut.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 41 Hatherley Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Broken and dangerous road surface, 28th August
item.description:
The road surface is badly broken up and is a real danger to cyclists particularly those coming down Leckhampton Hill. The worse area is from the Old Bath Road to the Charlton Lane junctions. The surface requires immediate work to bring it up to an acceptable and safe standard. It is currently a serious hazard yo both cyclists and motorists.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 188 Leckhampton Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
